case_vignette: A 34-year-old male presents with history of itching all over the body ongoing for the past year! He does not take any medications other than multivitamins! He denies any history of skin conditions! He has tried fexofenadine in the past which helped, but over the counter hydrocortisone only provides minimal relief! Pruritus is worse around areas of tight clothing contacting his skin that occurs within a few minutes! Skin examination reveals linear urticaria on the upper back that develop after two minutes in areas of gentle scratching with a cotton tip applicator!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have been experiencing itching all over my body for the past year.
Has the itching been constant or does it come and go?
The itching comes and goes, especially getting worse around areas where my clothing is tight.
Have you noticed any visible changes on your skin such as redness, rashes, or bumps where it itches?
Yes, I've noticed linear raised areas on my upper back that develop after scratching.
Do you have any known allergies or have you started using any new personal care products recently?
I do not have any known allergies, and I haven't started using any new personal care products recently.
Have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions or are you currently taking any medications?
I have not been diagnosed with any medical conditions and I am not taking any medications other than multivitamins.
Do any of your family members have similar symptoms or any diagnosed skin conditions?
No, none of my family members have similar symptoms or any diagnosed skin conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Dermatographia

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A patient has been experiencing itching all over their body for the past year. The itching fluctuates in intensity and worsens in areas where the clothing is tight. The patient notes the presence of linear raised areas on their upper back that appear after scratching. The patient does not have any known allergies and has not started using any new personal care products recently. Moreover, the patient has not been diagnosed with any medical conditions and is currently not taking any medications except for multivitamins. Additionally, no family members have similar symptoms or any diagnosed skin conditions.
trial_0.summarized_frq: Dermatographic urticaria (also known as dermographism or skin writing).
